title: Processes - Average Value of a Function

content.question: If the average value of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="2 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is 3, what is the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 6, of, open parenthesis, 5 times f of x, plus 2, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
